Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Provides several different visual representations for a list of selectable items. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> class maintains the selection of single or multiple selected items. The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> is derived directly from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl> class and does not have any of the pagination handling properties, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.ItemWeight%2A> property.
## Examples In the following code example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.DataSource%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> class is an array of values that is created during the initial page load. You can change the setting of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.SelectType%2A> property to see different versions of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList>.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Syntax Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/09074b20-ece9-46fa-bc8f-ab2595ed2c02).
[!code-aspx-csharp[MobileListItemSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileListItemSample/cs/Default.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[MobileListItemSample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileListItemSample/vb/Default.aspx#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data member to extract when data binding to a list data source. The default value is an empty string (""). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The data member to extract when data binding to a list data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is only used if the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.DataSource%2A> property is of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>, rather than of type <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data source of the list that is being bound. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The data source of the list that is being bound.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To bind a data source to a list, you must first use the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.DataBind%2A> method to ensure data binding. The data source can either be of type <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable>, or it can be of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>. If the data source is of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.DataMember%2A> field to specify which member to extract.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To create a multiple-selection <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList>, set its <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.SelectType%2A> property to <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListSelectType.MultiSelectListBox?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event ItemDataBind As ListDataBindEventHandler

Docs.summary: Occurs when an item in the list is bound to data. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When an item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> control is created and data-bound, this event handler sets the properties of the list item from arbitrary expressions.
An item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> control is of type <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem>.
This event is raised as each data source item is bound. This is the best time to filter or group items of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> collection, by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Items As MobileListItemCollection

Docs.summary: Returns the collection of items in a list. The default value is an empty collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The collection of items in the selection list.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can add or remove items from a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.Remove%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> class.

Docs.returns: if the state of the changes as a result of the postback; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.LoadPostData%2A> method uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter.LoadPostData%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter> object referenced by the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Adapter%2A> property to load data into the control from the post data sent by the client browser. If there is no device-specific handling for loading the postback data on this control, then the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter.LoadPostData%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method returns `true`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows in the selection list. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The number of rows in the selection list.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value is 4; the minimum is 1, with no maximum.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.Rows%2A> property on postback to expand the list.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Syntax Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/09074b20-ece9-46fa-bc8f-ab2595ed2c02).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int SelectedIndex { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.SelectedIndex : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns the index of the selected item. The default value is -1. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The index of the selected item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the control is in multiple selection mode, this property returns the index of the first selected item. The selected index cannot be set declaratively; use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Selected%2A> property of a list item instead. Set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.SelectedIndex%2A> to -1 to clear the selection. This is useful when you want to dynamically remove items from the list.

Docs.exception: an attempt was made to set the property to less than or greater than or equal to the number of items.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event SelectedIndexChanged As EventHandler

Docs.summary: Occurs whenever a user changes the selection of a object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Changing the selection on the client does not generate a postback event. This event is called on the server if a postback event is generated by some other control and the selection has changed.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.SelectedIndexChanged> event. It also shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.Rows%2A> property on postback to expand the list.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Syntax Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/09074b20-ece9-46fa-bc8f-ab2595ed2c02).
[!code-aspx-csharp[MobileSelectionListSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileSelectionListSample/cs/Default.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[MobileSelectionListSample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileSelectionListSample/vb/Default.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Selection As MobileListItem

Docs.summary: Returns the selected item, or if there is no selection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The currently selected item in the selection list.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the control is in multiple selection mode, this property returns the first selected item.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::UI::MobileControls::ListSelectType SelectType { System::Web::UI::MobileControls::ListSelectType get(); void set(System::Web::UI::MobileControls::ListSelectType value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of UI used to provide a selection UI. Must be of type . The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: Type of UI used to provide a selection UI.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> object can be rendered as a `CheckBox`, `DropDown`, `ListBox`, `MultiSelectListBox`, or `Radio` list, depending on the target device. The selection type also affects whether the control allows the user to select multiple items. The `MultiSelectListBox` and `CheckBox` settings allow multiple selections; other settings allow only a single selection. The selection types are shown in the following table.
|`ListSelectType` value|Description|Multiselect| |----------------------------|-----------------|-----------------| |`CheckBox`|Renders list items with check boxes and multiple selection capability.|Yes| |`DropDown`|Renders list items in a drop-down list box.|No| |`ListBox`|Renders list items in a list box.|No| |`MultipleSelectionListBox`|Renders list items in a list box with multiple selection capability.|Yes| |`Radio`|Renders list items as options.|No|
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.SelectedIndexChanged> event. It also shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.Rows%2A> property on postback to expand the list.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Syntax Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/09074b20-ece9-46fa-bc8f-ab2595ed2c02).
[!code-aspx-csharp[MobileSelectionListSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileSelectionListSample/cs/Default.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[MobileSelectionListSample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileSelectionListSample/vb/Default.aspx#1)]
